definitions: educational institution offering courses in technical subjects and applied sciences
examples: She studied engineering at the local polytechnic college
The polytechnic offers both degree and diploma programs

definitions: religious belief system that recognizes and worships multiple deities or divine beings
examples: Ancient Greek religion was based on polytheism
Polytheism contrasts with monotheistic belief systems

definitions: versatile plastic material used in foam products, coatings, and adhesives
examples: The mattress contains layers of polyurethane foam
Polyurethane coating protects the wood from moisture

definitions: round fruit with tough red skin containing many edible seeds
examples: She added pomegranate seeds to her salad
Pomegranate juice is rich in antioxidants

definitions: rounded knob on the handle end of a sword or dagger
raised front part of a horse saddle
examples: The knight gripped the pommel of his sword
The decorative pommel was made of silver
She held onto the pommel while mounting the horse
The saddle's pommel provided extra security

definitions: splendid display of ceremony and magnificent show of celebration
examples: The royal wedding was celebrated with great pomp
Military parades often display pomp and circumstance

definitions: hairstyle where hair is swept upward and backward from the forehead
examples: Elvis Presley was famous for his pompadour hairstyle
The barber styled his hair into a classic pompadour

definitions: simple garment consisting of a large piece of cloth with a hole for the head
examples: She wore a colorful poncho over her sweater
The rain poncho kept him dry during the storm

definitions: strong unpleasant smell or stench that fills an area
examples: There was a terrible pong coming from the garbage
The pong of rotten eggs filled the kitchen

definitions: the Pope or high priest, especially the head of the Roman Catholic Church
examples: The pontiff addressed thousands in St. Peter's Square
Many pilgrims traveled to meet the pontiff

definitions: flat-bottomed boat or floating structure used to support bridges or docks
examples: The temporary bridge was built on pontoons
Seaplanes often land near floating pontoon docks

definitions: small horse typically under 14.2 hands high at the shoulder
examples: Children learn to ride on gentle ponies
The Shetland pony grazed in the pasture

definitions: hairstyle where hair is pulled back and fastened at the back of the head
examples: She wore her hair in a high ponytail
His long ponytail reached down to his shoulders

definitions: intelligent dog breed with distinctive curly coat in various sizes
examples: The standard poodle won best in show
Her toy poodle loves to play fetch

definitions: solid waste matter discharged from the bowels
raised deck at the stern of a ship
examples: The dog left poop on the sidewalk
Parents often deal with baby poop
The captain stood on the poop deck
Waves crashed over the ship's poop

definitions: historical institution providing housing and support for impoverished people
examples: Many elderly ended up in the poorhouse
The old poorhouse building is now a museum

definitions: corn kernels heated until they burst open into light fluffy pieces
examples: We always buy popcorn at the movie theater
The microwave popcorn filled the room with aroma

definitions: fast-growing tree with triangular leaves that flutter in the breeze
examples: The poplar trees lined both sides of the avenue
Lombardy poplars grow tall and narrow

definitions: device or utensil used for popping corn or other items
small glass ampoule containing amyl nitrite used as recreational drug
examples: The corn popper churned out fresh popcorn
She used a popper to make kettle corn
The club scene was associated with poppers use
Medical poppers were originally used for angina

definitions: small figure of a person used as a doll or in magic
affectionate term for a small child or loved one
examples: The witch doctor used a poppet in the ritual
Children played with corn husk poppets
Come here, my little poppet
She called her granddaughter poppet

definitions: action or sound of something bursting open or making sharp explosive noises
examples: The popping of champagne corks filled the room
We could hear the popping of firecrackers outside

definitions: plant with showy flowers, often red, some species producing opium
examples: Red poppies bloomed in the wheat field
The poppy is a symbol of remembrance

definitions: the general public or ordinary people of a country or area
examples: The populace demanded democratic reforms
News of the victory spread quickly among the populace

definitions: process of making something understandable and appealing to the general public
examples: The popularisation of science helps educate citizens
His popularisation of classical music reached new audiences

definitions: process of making something understandable and appealing to the general public
examples: The popularization of smartphones changed communication
Carl Sagan contributed to the popularization of astronomy

definitions: political approach appealing to ordinary people who feel their concerns are ignored by elites
examples: The rise of populism changed the political landscape
Economic hardship often fuels populism movements

definitions: person who supports or seeks support from ordinary people against privileged elites
examples: The populist candidate promised to fight corruption
Many populist leaders emerge during economic crises

definitions: hard, white, translucent ceramic material made by heating refined clay
examples: The antique porcelain vase was extremely valuable
She collected delicate porcelain figurines

definitions: large rodent covered with sharp spines or quills for defense
examples: The porcupine raised its quills when threatened
Porcupines are mostly nocturnal creatures

definitions: tiny opening in skin or surface through which fluids may pass
examples: Sweat comes out through pores in your skin
The facial treatment helps unclog blocked pores

definitions: sexually explicit material intended to cause sexual arousal
examples: Internet filters block access to porn sites
The debate about porn continues in many societies

definitions: informal term for pornographic material or films
examples: The video store had a separate porno section
Many countries regulate porno distribution

definitions: printed or visual material containing explicit description or display of sexual activity
examples: The committee discussed laws regarding pornography
Child pornography is illegal in all countries

definitions: quality of being porous or having spaces that allow fluids to pass through
examples: The porosity of the rock affects water flow
Engineers tested the concrete's porosity

definitions: small toothed whale with a blunt rounded snout
examples: A pod of porpoises swam alongside the boat
Harbor porpoises are common in coastal waters

definitions: hot dish of oatmeal or other grain boiled in water or milk
examples: She ate porridge with honey for breakfast
The three bears' porridge was too hot

definitions: quality of being easily carried or moved from place to place
examples: The laptop's portability makes it ideal for travel
Software portability allows programs to run on different systems

definitions: object or device designed to be easily carried or moved
examples: She brought a portable speaker to the beach
The portable heater warmed the small room

definitions: practice of carrying boats or goods overland between navigable waters
examples: The canoeists faced a difficult portage
Native Americans established portage routes

definitions: doorway, gate, or entrance, especially a large and imposing one
website providing access to other sites or services
examples: They passed through the ancient portal
The cathedral's portal featured intricate carvings
Students log in through the university portal
The portal provides access to all services

definitions: person employed to carry luggage and other loads
dark brown bitter beer brewed from charred malt
examples: The porter helped with our heavy suitcases
Railway porters were once common at stations
He ordered a pint of porter at the pub
Porter beer originated in 18th century London

definitions: roof supported by columns at the entrance to a building
examples: Guests gathered under the mansion's grand portico
The portico provided shelter from the rain

definitions: large trunk or suitcase that opens into two equal parts
word blending sounds and meanings of two different words
examples: The vintage portmanteau held all her belongings
Travelers packed portmanteaus for long voyages
'Brunch' is a portmanteau of breakfast and lunch
Lewis Carroll created many portmanteau words

definitions: artist who specializes in painting or drawing portraits of people
examples: The famous portraitist captured her essence perfectly
Court portraitists painted members of royalty

definitions: art or practice of making portraits through painting, photography, or other media
examples: She studied portraiture at the art academy
Renaissance portraiture captured individual character

definitions: act of describing or representing someone or something in a particular way
examples: His portrayal of the villain was convincing
The book's portrayal of war was realistic

definitions: ongoing action of representing or describing someone or something
examples: The artist spent months portraying the landscape
Portraying historical figures requires careful research

definitions: act of assuming a particular position for artistic or photographic purposes
examples: The model was posing for fashion photographers
Children enjoyed posing for the family portrait
